  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered on the unload side. Package was placed in a lined tote and brought to the QA department. Upon further investigation, it was discovered that the one of the containers had a loose cap and spilled inside of the package.

item.title: Report X-2024051287
item.description:
Report X-2024051287

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A WET PACKAGE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH 1 SIDE WET. WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED IT WAS FOUND THAT ALL 4 TOPS WERE LOOSE. FOLLOWIING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SEDCURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED

item.title: Report X-2024050891
item.description:
Report X-2024050891

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: MATTHEWS
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET PACKAGE FOUND IN TRAILIER #56123 ALREADY DAMAGED WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 5 LITER PLASTIC BOTTLES OF MEDIVATORS RAPICIDE PA PART A AND PART B ONE 5 LITER PLASTIC BOTTLE OF RAPICIDE PART B HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING LEAKAGE AND ALLOWING .25 LITERS TO RELEASE PACKAGE DID HAVE SLOTTED PARTITIONS AND A INNER BOX NO BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024050965
item.description:
Report X-2024050965

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAG ON THE GROUND WITH THE BOTTOM WET. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE, 1 OF THE GALLON CONAINERS CAP WAS LOOSE. FOLLOWIING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETRNED TO THE DMP CAE TO BE PROCESSED

item.title: Report X-2024050788
item.description:
Report X-2024050788

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE DA PROCESSING AREA AS AN AUDITOR TO AUDIT SOME PACKAGES THAT WERE PUT ON THE BELT. WHILE COLLECTING THE PACKAGES, NOTICED THAT ONE WAS LEAKING A LITTLE. RESPONDER STOPPED THE MOVEMENT OF THE PACKAGE, COLLECTED PPE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL, AND BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
